name: Crystalloid Solution
side_effects: Increased intracranial pressure (large volumes, concern in patients already with ICP)

general: TBSA - Total Body Surface Area - severity of burns metric measuring only 2nd and 3rd degree burns
pedi: Normal Saline Bolus: 10-20 mL/kg Bolus max 60 mL/kg {IV/IO} See specific protocol for exact dosage
[TB3] Normal Saline: Entrapped < 2 hours - 3x maintenance fluid rate infusion - Entrapped > 2 hours - maintenance fluid rate infusion {IV/IO}
(Burns) Lactated Ringer or NS: TBSA < 20% - 0.25 mL/kg * (TBSA%)/hr
(Burns) Lactated Ringer or NS: TBSA >= 20% and age <= 5 - 125 mL/hr
(Burns) Lactated Ringer or NS: TBSA >= 20% and age 6-14 - 250 mL/hr
adult: Normal Saline Bolus: 500 mL - 1 Liter Bolus max 1-2 Liter {IV/IO} See specific protocol for exact dosage
[TB3] Normal Saline: Entrapped < 2 hours - 1 Liter per hour infusion - Entrapped > 2 hours - 500 mL per hour infusion  {IV/IO}
(Burns) Lactated Ringer or NS: TBSA < 20% - 0.25 mL/kg * (TBSA%)/hr
(Burns) Lactated Ringer or NS: TBSA >= 20% - and age >= 15 500 mL/hr

pearls: Use Lactated Ringers (if available) for all Critical or Serious Burns [TB1]
For amputated parts - Wrap part in sterile dressing soaked in normal saline or lactated ringer [TB4]
For avulsed tooth - rinse with normal saline or lactated ringers [UP7]
